notes.note:
**Stronger site security**: We now enforce [Certificate Transparency][1]. Sites must prove their certificates were publicly logged before we trust them. This applies to certificates issued by CAs in Mozilla’s Root Program.


  [1]: https://wiki.mozilla.org/SecurityEngineering/Certificate_Transparency

**Smarter, faster protection**: Firefox now uses [CRLite][1] to check certificate revocation on your device. Pages load faster with less data shared and stronger protection against bad certificates.


  [1]: https://hacks.mozilla.org/2025/08/crlite-fast-private-and-comprehensive-certificate-revocation-checking-in-firefox/

Local translation models are now compressed with [Zstandard][1], reducing download sizes and on-device storage consumption. As always, all Firefox translations happen securely and privately on your local device, unlike other browsers that translate using cloud services.


  [1]: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zstd

text:
Thanks for using Firefox! Have feedback or suggestions? We'd love to hear from you at [Android Support][1]


  [1]: https://mzl.la/AndroidSupport
title: Firefox for Android 145.0 Release
